Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw different types of plants, showing which ones receive water by depicting them as healthy and hydrated.
The student can illustrate plants that have enough light with vibrant colors and demonstrate the difference when plants do not receive enough light by showing them with subdued or yellowed colors.
The student can identify and depict patterns in plant growth based on availability of light and water, possibly using arrows or lines to show growth direction.
The student can indicate that plants need both light and water by including labels or symbols for sunlight and water near the healthy plants.
CANNOT: The student might not consistently show wilted or browning plants when illustrating a lack of water, as there could be some slight inaccuracies in colouring or size due to natural variation in drawing skill.

The student might underrepresent or not fully detail yellowing in plants when there is an absence of light, possibly showing only slight changes in coloration rather than dramatic differences (e.g., use of too subtle yellow tones that are not easily seen).
